meanings.definition: The series of vertebrae extending from the skull to the pelvis, supporting the body and protecting the spinal cord.
meanings.sent1: Her spine helps her stand tall and walk straight.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined her spine to check for any injuries.
meanings.sent3: The spine of the book was so worn out that it looked like a caterpillar.
meanings.sent4: His strong will was the spine that held the team together.
meanings.sent5: The spine, like a sturdy pillar, provides the foundation for our body.

meanings.definition: A sharp, pointed part of an object.
meanings.sent1: Be careful with that spine of the cactus; it can prick you.
meanings.sent2: The hedgehog's spines help protect it from predators.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally sat on the spine of the chair and jumped up quickly.
meanings.sent4: The spine of the knife gleamed under the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The porcupine's spines stood up when it felt threatened.

meanings.definition: The central ridge or backbone of a book.
meanings.sent1: She traced her finger along the spine of the novel on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The spine of the textbook had the title and author's name printed on it.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally bent the spine of the comic book while reading it in bed.
meanings.sent4: The spine of the journal was decorated with intricate patterns.
meanings.sent5: The spine of the diary held the secrets of a lifetime within its pages.
